metadata.title: CVE-2022-48789 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nvme-tcp: fix possible use-after-free in transport error_recovery workWhile nvme_tcp_submit_async_event_work is checking the ctrl and queuestate before preparing the AER command and scheduling io_work, in orderto fully prevent a race where this check is not reliable the errorrecovery work must flush async_event_work before continuing to destroythe admin queue after setting the ctrl state to RESETTING such thatthere is no race .submit_async_event and the error recovery handleritself changing the ctrl state.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48789` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-110-generic - 5.4.0-110.124~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-110-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-110.124~18.04.1
